snippet: Days after an accident that killed an 8-month-old girl, the Hudson County sheriff said that deputies will make random stops to check for insurance and valid licenses.
abstract: Hudson County Sheriff Frank X Schillari orders 'massive crackdown' on commuter buses, days after driver Idowu Daramola hit light pole in West New York, NJ, that toppled onto stroller, killing 8-month-old Angelie Paredes; Daramola was charged with death by auto, reckless driving and using a cellphone while operating vehicle; Schillari has ordered deputies to conduct random stops to check for proper insurance and valid driver's license.
lead_paragraph: Days after an accident that killed an 8-month-old girl, the Hudson County sheriff said that deputies will make random stops to check for insurance and valid licenses.

headline.main: New Jersey Sheriff Plans to Enforce Standards for Commuter Bus Drivers
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Sheriff Plans to Enforce Standards for Commuter Bus Drivers
